page.title: 07Liskeard Cattle Market
page.content: Two markets are held each week.Monday is a Fat Stock Market auctioning sheep for slaughter.This market serves the Caradon District,but occasionally Lostwithiel farmers attend from the Restormel District.The larger market is on Thursdays when the main dealing is in Store Cattle.The chief areas served are Caradon,Restormel and West Devon,but farmers have attended from as far away as Penzance.Here calves are mainly sold either for rearing or further fattening.Last year,however, some bullocks were sold for slaughter, fetching Â£850 each.The average price is usually around Â£500-Â£600.Sheep sold for lamb usually sell at Â£30-Â£35 each. The market attracts many agricultural stalls with a stock ranging from farm machinery to produce and seed.
